result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley J Seehafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Probation review hearing on November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Probable Cause Found
Waiver of Preliminary Examination
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 2:40 pm. 
INCLUDES: 22CF289, 22CM134
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Julianne Lennon.
VRCW. 

Waiver of Prelim filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
22CF289 --
Ct.2(DC-Domestic Abuse Repeater[Repeater][Domestic Abuse Repeater][Domestic Abuse])>>DRI.
Ct.4(Misd.BJ/Repeater[Domestic Abuse Assessments])>>DRI.

22CM134 --
Ct.1(Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.

22CM135 --
Ct.1(Theft-Movable Property <=$2500)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CF289 --
Ct.1(DC-Domestic Abuse Repeater[Repeater][Domestic Abuse Repeater][Domestic Abuse])>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct.3(Misd.BJ/Repeater[Domestic Abuse Assessments])>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation; CONDITIONS: I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations.  I/S 30 hours community service for rule violations. Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety.  SAFE Intake Program and follow through.  AODA and follow through.  No violent contact with victim(s).  Probation Review Hearings.  Pay CC/DV surcharge.  Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 3 days credit. 
Probation Review Hearing: 11/18 at 1:15 pm. 

Adj: 2:54 pm.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): A.J.A.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Wausau PD).  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 

State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett.  Defendant appears from MCJ, with Atty Adam Fontana, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CM's.

COURT ORDERS: $2,500.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): K.J.A. or their residence.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence - Wausau PD. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
